item.title: 关键税收减免政策取消，EVgo 对收购充电公司持开放态度
item.description: 美国最大的充电公司之一EVgo公司首席执行官巴达尔-汗（Badar Khan）表示，随着一项关键的联邦补贴政策的终止，陷入困境的充电行业压力进一步加大，该公司对收购竞争对手持开放态度。【原文：EVgo Inc., one of America’s biggest charging companies, is open to buying its rivals as the end of a key federal subsidy adds further strain to the struggling industry, according to Chief Executive Officer Badar Khan.】

item.title: 内燃机产业衰退，Merz 敦促欧盟取消内燃机禁令
item.description: 德国总理弗里德里希-默茨（Friedrich Merz）呼吁欧盟放弃 2035 年有效禁用内燃机的最后期限，转而允许陷入困境的汽车行业以更柔和的方式实现气候中和。【原文：German Chancellor Friedrich Merz called on the European Union to give up its 2035 deadline to effectively ban combustion engines and instead allow the troubled car industry to pursue a softer path to climate neutrality.】

item.title: 亨伯托在波多黎各东北部达到飓风强度
item.description: 风暴 "亨伯托 "已达到飓风强度，在波多黎各和伊斯帕尼奥拉岛沿岸的大西洋上肆虐。【原文：Storm Humberto has reached hurricane strength as it churns across the Atlantic Ocean off the coast of Puerto Rico and Hispaniola.】

item.title: 欧洲投资银行考虑通过反应堆投资结束长达 40 年的核电停滞期
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，随着反对核电技术的政治声音逐渐减弱，欧洲投资银行正在探索四十年来首次投资欧洲大陆的核电项目。【原文：The European Investment Bank is exploring investing in nuclear power on the continent for the first time in four decades as political opposition to the technology fades, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 大豆需求飙升迫使农民深入巴西亚马逊地区
item.description:
随着该国对一项具有里程碑意义的暂停令展开调查，多年来的保护措施岌岌可危。【原文：

Years of protections are at risk as the country investigates a landmark moratorium. 

】

item.title: 日本电产发现更多可能存在不当会计的案例
item.description: 汽车制造商日本电产株式会社在一份延迟发布的年度证券报告中表示，该公司正要求第三方小组调查更多涉嫌不当会计的事件，这使日本科技冠军之一的日本电产又增添了一桩丑闻。【原文：Motor-maker Nidec Corp. said in a delayed annual securities report it was asking a third-party panel to look into additional suspected instances of improper accounting, adding to a scandal weighing on one of Japan’s tech champions.】

item.title: Tennet 表示，没有公众的支持，数十亿美元也无法修复荷兰电网
item.description: Tennet Holding BV 表示，要缓解欧洲部分地区最严重的电网拥堵问题，最大的障碍不是资金或工程技术，而是确保获得建设新基础设施的公共支持。【原文：Tennet Holding BV says its biggest barrier to easing some of Europe’s worst grid congestion isn’t money or engineering — it’s securing the public backing to build new infrastructure.】

item.title: 福特斯库称，尽管特朗普上台，人工智能热潮仍将推动美国可再生能源发展
item.description: 据 Fortescue Ltd. 公司称，唐纳德-特朗普总统对气候变化的否定和对可再生能源的攻击并不会大幅抑制美国对清洁电力的需求，人工智能将进一步加速美国向廉价、低碳能源的转变。【原文：President Donald Trump’s dismissal of climate change and attacks on renewable energy won’t significantly damp demand for clean power in the US, where artificial intelligence will further accelerate the shift to cheap, low-carbon energy, according to Fortescue Ltd.】

item.title: 中国太阳能装机量降至近三年新低
item.description: 由于国内需求低迷，生产商纷纷转向海外市场，8 月份中国太阳能电池板安装量再次放缓，创下近三年来的最低记录。【原文：Solar panel installations in China slowed again in August to hit the lowest in nearly three years, as producers turned to overseas markets amid sluggish domestic demand.】

item.title: 百度下一步将在澳大利亚和东南亚拓展机器人出租车业务
item.description: 随着其不断扩大的车队在中国多个城市实现运营盈利目标，百度公司正在为其机器人出租车开拓包括澳大利亚在内的新市场。【原文：Baidu Inc. is exploring new markets including Australia for its robotaxis as its expanding fleet hits operational profitability targets in several cities across China.】

item.title: 中国绿色钢铁转型因电炉产量低而受挫
item.description: 由于电弧炉（EAF）产量低，中国钢厂将无法实现关键的减排目标。【原文：Chinese steel mills are set to miss a key emissions-reduction target because of low production from electric-arc furnaces (EAFs).】

item.title: 组织称美国正与各国就海上风电争端进行谈判
item.description: 美国一个清洁能源贸易组织的负责人说，特朗普政府和东北部多个州的官员正在进行谈判，以解决一个庞大的、几近完工的海上风电项目的争端。【原文：The Trump administration and officials from multiple Northeast states are in talks to resolve a dispute over a massive, nearly complete offshore wind project that was ordered to shut down in August, the head of a US clean energy trade group said.】

item.title: 美国放弃了气候领导地位。印度能否挺身而出？
item.description:
ReNew公司首席执行官苏曼特-辛哈（Sumant Sinha）看好印度的清洁能源计划，并不担心如何筹集资金快速部署太阳能和风能。【原文：

Sumant Sinha, chief executive officer of ReNew, is bullish about India’s clean-energy plan and isn’t worried about raising capital to deploy solar and wind power fast.

】

item.title: Amundi 高管认为与资产所有者的关系正在 "洗牌"。
item.description: Amundi SA 首席责任投资官 Elodie Laugel 表示，资产管理公司如何处理气候风险，在欧洲机构投资者分配任务时的选择中发挥着越来越重要的作用。【原文：How an asset manager handles climate risk is playing an increasingly important role in the choices that European institutional investors make when assigning mandates, according to Elodie Laugel, chief responsible investment officer at Amundi SA.】

item.title: 顶级橙汁制造商利用绿色信贷资助病树迁移
item.description: 世界上最大的橙汁加工商之一正在利用碳信用额来资助巴西柑橘产业摆脱病虫害果园的昂贵举措。【原文：One of the world’s biggest orange juice processors is turning to carbon credits to help finance the Brazilian citrus industry’s costly move away from disease-laden orchards.】

item.title: 法国希望将钢铁保护作为实现欧盟排放目标的条件
item.description: 法国希望欧盟承诺加强对钢铁行业的贸易保护，并修改碳税，然后再支持欧盟提出的到 2040 年将减排速度提高到 90% 的建议。【原文：France wants the European Union to commit to strengthening trade protection for the steel industry and to revising its carbon levy before backing the bloc’s proposal to speed emissions cuts to 90% by 2040.】

item.title: 大西洋飓风季节在沉睡开始后苏醒
item.description:
风暴 "亨伯托 "和 "加布里埃尔 "已经形成，拉开了下半赛季更加活跃的序幕。【原文：

Storms Humberto and Gabrielle have formed, kicking off what’s shaping up to be a more active second half of the season.

】

item.title: 克莱因出售核电开发商股份后，Oklo 公司股价暴跌
item.description: 在宣布丘吉尔资本公司（Churchill Capital Corp.）董事迈克尔-克莱因（Michael Klein）出售了其在这家先进核反应堆开发商所持的 670 万美元股份后，Oklo 公司的股价创下了五个月来的最大跌幅。【原文：Oklo Inc. tumbled the most in five months after announcing that director Michael Klein of Churchill Capital Corp. sold $6.7 million of his shares in the developer of advanced nuclear reactors.】

item.title: 洛杉矶大火烧毁了 11,000 所房屋。只有不到 10%的房屋获得重建许可
item.description: 今年的加州野火过后，成千上万的居民需要重建家园，安迪-韦曼似乎是其中的佼佼者。这位电视和舞台剧导演在五年前刚刚改建了自己在马里布的家，他手头有市政府批准的蓝图，并由同一位建筑师负责监督重建工作。【原文：Of the thousands of residents needing to rebuild after this year’s California wildfires, Andy Weyman would seem especially well positioned. The TV and stage director had remodeled his Malibu home just five years earlier and had city-approved blueprints in hand, with the same architect set to oversee reconstruction.】

item.title: Centrus 计划投资数十亿美元促进铀燃料供应
item.description: Centrus Energy Corp. 正计划投资数十亿美元来提高铀燃料的产量，这是为目前严重依赖俄罗斯进口的核反应堆开发美国供应链所做努力的一部分。【原文：Centrus Energy Corp. is planning a multi-billion dollar investment to boost production of uranium fuel, part of an effort to develop the US supply chain for nuclear reactors that currently rely heavily on imports from Russia.】

item.title: 华尔街正将气候融资变成能源安全宣传
item.description: 纽约气候周从未吸引过如此多的人。与会的银行家们也从未如此热衷于与气候融资的传统框架保持距离。【原文：Never before has New York climate week attracted so many people. And never before have the bankers attending been so keen to distance themselves from the traditional framing of climate finance.】

item.title: 发展中国家电动汽车的非凡崛起
item.description:
彭博新闻社（BloombergNEF）交通主管科林-麦凯拉彻（Colin McKerracher）与零点一起讨论全球电动汽车销售的最新趋势。【原文：

Colin McKerracher, head of transport for BloombergNEF, joins Zero to discuss the latest global trends in electric-vehicle sales.

】

item.title: 中国微弱的气候目标对清洁技术的支持微乎其微
item.description: 中国国家主席习近平宣布了中国应能轻松实现的可再生能源和电动汽车目标后，中国陷入困境的清洁技术巨头在未来十年的增长将依赖市场力量而非政策授权。【原文：China’s struggling clean-tech giants will be reliant on market forces — not policy mandates — for growth over the next decade after President Xi Jinping announced targets for renewables and electric vehicles that the country should comfortably achieve.】

item.title: 暴风雨拉加萨在侵袭中国南部后向越南方向移动
item.description: 热带风暴拉加萨正在向越南北部移动，有可能给首都河内带来暴雨。【原文：Tropical Storm Ragasa is moving toward northern Vietnam, threatening to drench the capital of Hanoi with heavy rain, after weakening overnight as the system tracked across southern China.】

item.title: 美国计划使用紧急权力阻止关闭更多煤矿
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，特朗普政府计划继续使用紧急授权来阻止燃煤电厂退役。【原文：The Trump administration plans to continue using emergency authority to stop coal-fired power plants from retiring, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 大西洋风暴 "亨伯托 "形成，双系统可能性增加
item.description: 热带风暴 "汉贝托 "已在大西洋形成，成为今年的第八个风暴，并有可能形成罕见的孪生系统。【原文：Tropical Storm Humberto has formed in the Atlantic Ocean, making it this year’s eighth storm and potentially setting up a rare occurrence — twin systems.】

item.title: 中国首次承诺减少温室气体排放，稳妥行事
item.description:
其他国家在达到气候 污染—峰值后实现了更大幅度的减排，而世界上最大的排放国已经超额完成了自己的目标

。【原文：

Other nations have achieved larger declines after reaching peak climate pollution — and the world’s biggest emitter has exceeded its own goals

】

item.title: 中国承诺到 2035 年将温室气体排放量减少 7% 至 10
item.description: 作为世界上最大的污染国，中国制定了在未来十年内将温室气体排放量减少 7% 至 10% 的目标，但这一战略被认为过于温和，无法使中国走上净零排放的道路，也无法激励全球气候行动。【原文：China, the world’s largest polluter, set a target to cut greenhouse gas emissions 7% to 10% over the next decade, a strategy that’s seen as too modest to put the nation on a path to net zero and galvanize global climate action.】

item.title: Xcel 就 2021 年科罗拉多州野火事件达成 6.4 亿美元和解协议
item.description: 公用事业公司 Xcel Energy Inc. 同意支付约 6.4 亿美元，以解决其线路导致 2021 年科罗拉多州历史上损失最惨重的野火被点燃的索赔问题。【原文：Utility Xcel Energy Inc. agreed to pay about $640 million to resolve claims that its lines contributed to the 2021 ignition of the costliest wildfire in Colorado history.】

item.title: 爱迪生公司将在感恩节前开放洛杉矶火灾赔偿申请
item.description: 爱迪生国际公司首席执行官佩德罗-皮萨罗（Pedro Pizarro）表示，爱迪生国际公司预计将在感恩节 "之前 "开始接受申请，为今年 1 月摧毁洛杉矶大片地区的伊顿大火的受害者提供赔偿。【原文：Edison International expects to begin accepting applications “well before” Thanksgiving to compensate victims of the deadly Eaton Fire that destroyed swaths of the Los Angeles area in January, according to Chief Executive Officer Pedro Pizarro.】
